action.action-desc: Mrs. Miller of Illinois introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To establish certain protections for members of the Armed Forces who refuse to receive vaccinations against COVID-19, and to increase basic pay for members of the uniformed services.

section.header: Protections for members of the Armed Forces who refuse to receive vaccinations against COVID-19

paragraph.text: No Federal funds may be used to require a member of the Armed Forces to receive a vaccination against COVID-19.
The Secretary concerned may not take any adverse action against a member of the Armed Forces solely on the basis that such member refuses to receive a vaccination against COVID-19.
The term adverse action includes the following:

subparagraph.text: A requirement to wear a mask.
A requirement to reside in substandard housing.

paragraph.text: The term Secretary concerned has the meaning given that term in section 101 of title 10, United States Code.

section.header: Increase in basic pay for members of the uniformed services
section.text: Effective on January 1, 2023, the rates of monthly basic pay for members of the uniformed services are increased by 2.7 percent.
